html.problem:
A person wants to move a file cabinet of mass m up an incline of angle \(\alpha\) with respect to the horizontal. There is friction between the cabinet and the surface (\(\mu_s\), \(\mu_k\)).
Part a. When the person applies a force parallel to the incline surface of magnitude F , the box does not move. Which of the following statements are correct?
The force of static friction is pointing down the incline
The force of static friction is pointing up the incline
The force of static friction is zero
Depending on the value of F, one of the statements shown above is correct.
Feedback:
The force of static friction will depend on the magnitude of the applied force, F, and on the component of the cabinet's weight along the surface, mgsinα. The force of static friction is a constraint force as it keeps the cabinet at rest by changing its magnitude and direction according to Newton's second law (ΣF = 0).
If F > mgsinα, the force of static friction must be directed downhill, otherwise the cabinet will move up.
If F = mgsinα, no force of friction is needed to keep the cabinet at rest.
If F < mgsinα, the force of friction must be pointed uphill, otherwise the cabinet will slide down.
